description: God is ashamed of your actions. Use when the user does something ridiculous or embarrassing.
A man looks at a noose with ironic intent. Use when something mildly unfortunate happens, like pulling the wrong item. Do NOT use for serious issues.
A flick to the user’s forehead. Use when the user speaks badly about themselves or insults others.
A man falls off the bed in shock. Use when something scary or unexpected appears in chat. Also fits random chaotic moments.
A frog yelling 'STOP'. Use to interrupt something disturbing or annoying.
A character throws their hand out and backs away suddenly, as if the user scared them.
A tree poster says 'Have you seen him? Now you have :)' showing Tartaglia. Use randomly or in Childe/Tartalia-related conversations.
A penguin writes 'Noted' in a notebook. Fits almost any message, used ironically.
A man throws a rat. Use when someone says 'крыса'.
Jesus is visibly shocked by what he's just read. Use for shocking or blasphemous messages.
Doge gently touches his heart. Use when something is heartwarming or emotionally touching.
Bot apologizing for the cringe. Use when the bot itself did or said something awkward or embarrassing.
A character smiling calmly while everything burns in the background. Use during chaotic or absurd moments.
A teary-eyed bird saying 'Yamero' (stop it). Use when something emotionally overwhelming or sad happens.
A character raising an eyebrow like 'gotcha' or 'really?'. Use in sarcastic or suspicious replies.
Text says 'a face full of intellect'. Use sarcastically on the bot’s own messages or things like 'сглыпа)'.
A possum screaming 'AAAA'. Use when something is panic-inducing, chaotic, or just too much.
A character smiling while internally in total shock. Use when pretending everything is fine, but it’s really not.
A character wagging their finger in front of their face, like 'tsk tsk, stop it'. Use to call out someone’s behavior.
Qiqi from Genshin looking down with the text 'Pathetic'. Use to mock someone gently.
Anime judges crying while giving a perfect 10/10 score. Use when praising someone dramatically.
A character holding their own boobs in fear with the caption 'hold boobs in fear'. Use during scary or absurd situations.
Comic where a girl looks at her phone lovingly, then kisses it. Use when someone says something sweet or flattering.
A character raising a gun in a fake-intense way. Use as an ironic overreaction or threat.
A nun prays in front of her computer. Use after seeing something cursed or sinful in chat.
Character loading a shotgun with the caption 'God forgives, I don't'. Use when someone's behavior crosses the line.
Doge dressed as a clown with 'hahan't' written. Use when something was supposed to be funny but failed.
A bright ironic image saying 'No thanks, I already cried today'. Use when someone shares something sad.
A smug cat with a caption revealing he just lied to you. Use in response to obvious lies or sarcasm.
A guy telling someone: 'You're a lioness, a true queen, a natural winner'. Use to uplift someone.
